SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 5th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) British Front. Yesterday, north of the LYS, we attacked and took Hill 63, capturing over 100 prisoners, and in the afternoon captured PLOEGSTEERTE village, taking another 100 prisoners and a number of machine guns.
Our troops held the general line VOORMEZEELE, WULVERGHEM, PLOEGSTEERTE village, NIEPPE, LE TILLELOY, (South east of LAVENTIE), the outskirts of NEUVE CHAPELLE, GIVENCHY. South of NEUVE CHAPELLE as far as GIVENCHY we have regained the old line held by us prior to the 9th April, and east of GIVENCHY have captured portions of the old German positions.
On the battle front south of the SCARPE the enemy counter-attacked yesterday and re-took INCHY-EN-ARTOIS. This was subsequently retaken by us after sharp fighting.
We have improved our positions south of MOEUVRES and east of HERMIES and have taken NEUVILLE-BOURJONVAL.
East of PERONNE the Australians have taken FLAMICOURT. During the past 4 days we have taken over 16,000 prisoners and over 100 guns.
(b) French Front. On the French Front last night east of NOYON the line ran APPILLY, MONDESCOURT, BEAUGIES, GUISCARD, FRENICHES, ESMERY HALLON, BREUIL, ROUY-LE-GRAND, thence as before.
On the VESLE front the enemy have retired and the French line reached last night was VENTAUX, BASILEUX, BLANZY, VAUXCERRE, VAUXTIN, BRENELLE, CHASSENY.
ITALIAN FRONT. On the night 3rd-4th September the Austrians succeeded on their second attempt in capturing MONTE MANTELLO and MONTE SAN MATTEO.
MACDONIAN FRONT. There is no change.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
5th September 1918.
Issued at 12.50 p.m.
